Message.Title: Yahoo is going higher....much higher
Message.Msg: Marissa has her sights on being the next Google. No we are not going to have fancy glasses or robotic cars. What Yahoo will have is a compelling reasons for people for visit the site(s) on a daily basis. And that translates to revenue. Whether it's for sports, biz, weather, omg/gossip, etc. etc. etc. Marissa wants Yahoo to be King of the daly destination. Kudos for her having the balls to get rid of the slackers. I say at least 10% to 15% needs to go. Don't worry about the telecommute quitting....they were not doing anything in the first place. Remember...numbers don't lie. If you logged in for 5% on a daily basis, you're a slacker!!!! No soup for you and good riddance! My prediction....we are heading to $25, then $40, then once we hit $100....the sky is the limit. I'm staying long and doubling down when I can. In 4 years we will be over $250. Mark this note. : Good luck to all!

Message.Title: Keep an eye of YHOO's 35% stakes in YJ
Message.Msg: Nobody even Wall Street expecting this turbo pace of YJ market value. 35% stakes is huge. Wall Street and big time analysts are reacting positively about this large e-commerce in Japan finally. It is part of the upgrade but I do not think this is even price in to YHOO shares because YHOO is not making noise about possible deal in the near term. Where is the news of YHOO/MSFT deal (31 Mar)? YHOO to $26 soon.

Message.Title: To all you numbskulls thinking YHOO will be taken out...Can't happen...here's why
Message.Msg: There is a clause that states if Yahoo gets taken over or merges with another company as equals or less than they forfeit all claims to Alibaba with a cash payout from Alibaba of 1.5 Billion dollars. Surely if you factor that in they are not even worth $15/share. Add to that the loss on Yahoo Japan where they lose all of their ownership in YJ. So there you have the details and why it can't happen! So quit talking about it!!! I'm sick of you stupid numbskulls!!!!

Topic.Title: To all you numbskulls thinking YHOO will be taken out...Can't happen...here's why

Message.Msg: Well basher, I guess you might as well try to get the price of yhoo lower, but I will not wish you luck. I do not expect yhoo to be sold, too much unrecognized value. So, where exactly do you see yahoo once Alibaba does its ipo? You boast for goog, I have no problem with that but it appears you only do so as a means to bash yhoo. IMO, in a year I expect YHOO to be higher than it is today and will buy accordingly. My strategy is always to buy low and take some profits as a stock rises, and I have done this with YHOO, but I will take my chances with my core shares, if it drops back I will pick up more and I have my eye on some other companies (if google pulls back they will go on my list).

Topic.Title: ok, what's this?

Message.Msg: It's a MESSAGE FROM CHINA... "ALL YOUR BASE (PRICE) ARE BELONG TO US!!" (AYBABTU for short). Ok, Ok I know the basis for the whole AYBABTU thing was Japanese, not Chinese but I had to go with "Li Yui" in the header. But it is still a great reminder that Yahoo is a MEDIA company, not a tech company!

Message.Title: Alibaba featured in Economist/ front page
Message.Msg: Headline from cover: The Alibaba Phenomenom Could a Chinese Internet business become the world's most valuable company? Cites upcoming IPO with valuation ..." somewhere between $55 billion and more than $120 billion."

Topic.Title: Alibaba featured in Economist/ front page

Message.Msg: I am beginning to feel that this IPO will be blockbuster news for YHOO. No one knows exactly the market valuation of this IPO until Alibaba submitted his paperwork for IPO. The cited estimates of the IPO ranging from $55B to $120B is simply a huge money that will the affect valuation of YHOO shareholders values. I am not sure how much was priced in to YHOO shares to date.
